intro: Ruellia strictopaniculata, commonly known as the narrow-panicle ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of blue or purple, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Ruellia strictopaniculata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
